law.text:
// EFFECTIVE UNTIL MAY 31, 2013 PER CHAPTERS 626 AND 627 OF 2008 //
In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Certified nonprofit corporation" means a nonprofit corporation certified under this subtitle to establish and operate a public-private health care program.
"Health care provider" means any person, including a physician or hospital, who is licensed or otherwise authorized to provide health care services in the State.
"Health care services" has the meaning stated in § 19-701 of the Health - General Article.
"Qualifying individual" means an individual who:
is not eligible for or enrolled in the federal Medicare program, the Maryland Primary Adult Care Program, or the Maryland Children's Health Program;
is not covered under a health benefit plan issued under Title 15, Subtitle 12 of this article; and
meets any other eligibility requirements established by a public-private health care program.
"Participants" means qualifying individuals enrolled in a public-private health care program.
"Public-private health care program" means a program that:
is established and operated by a nonprofit corporation that:
has been certified by the Commissioner under this subtitle; and
has entered into a written agreement with each county in which the program proposes to operate; and
for a membership fee, provides or arranges for the provision of health care services for participants.
